thread.title: Four injured in drive-by shooting in Oak Park area
thread.title_full: Four injured in drive-by shooting in Oak Park area

author: Bee Metro Staff
title: Four injured in drive-by shooting in Oak Park area
text:
March 4, 2017 8:31 PM Four injured in drive-by shooting in Oak Park area 
Covering crime, police and courts in the Sacramento region i 
Bee Metro Staff 
Four people were taken to the hospital Saturday night after a drive-by shooting in the 2500 block of 33rd Street in the Oak Park area, Sacramento Police Department reports. 
The shooting happened at 7:31 p.m. and all victims were alive when they were transported to the hospital, but two had life-threatening injuries, said Bryce Heinlein, police spokesman. 
There were no details about suspects or the vehicle involved in the shooting, Heinlein said. 
Return to sacbee.com for updates.
